DOC.brief_summary: Low back pain ( LBP ) one common reason seek medical care account 3.7 million physician visits/year U.S. alone . Ninety percent adult experience low back pain lifetime , 50 % experience recurrent LBP , 10 % develop chronic pain related disability . While grow evidence clinical effectiveness alternative complementary therapy treat low back pain , little known physiologic consequence effect treatment . Further , additional data need understand different treatment technique effect clinical change pain disability . The lack empirical data hinders acceptance wider scientific health-care community , also limit development rational strategy use alternative complementary therapy .
DOC.brief_title: The RELIEF Study - Researching Effectiveness Lumbar Interventions Enhancing Function
DOC.criteria: Report history consistent chronic low back pain Average pain intensity least mild assessed numerical pain scale At least mild disability assess questionnaire Meets criteria clinical prediction rule A history certain neurological , cardiorespiratory , musculoskeletal disorder Have active cancer blind Report recent use certain medication treatment Report pregnant , lactating , anticipate become pregnant next 3months Have high body mass unexplained weight loss Have clinical depression Have pending litigation relate low back pain receiving type disability service Current drug alcohol use would interfere adherence study requirement
